title: Eastbound I-66 diverted in Virginia after vehicle strikes overhead gantry
text:
Eastbound lanes are closed at 5 p.m. Wednesday west of Route 28 after a vehicle struck an I-66 gantry.

Interstate 66 eastbound is closed in the Centreville area after a vehicle hit an overhead gantry, officials said.

At around 4:45 p.m., the Virginia Department of Transportation tweeted that I-66 eastbound was closed after a vehicle struck the gantry, which then was found to be structurally unsound.

VDOT spokeswoman Ellen Kamilakis said the sign was part of a traffic management system that was disabled for the expansion of I-66.

There were no reported injuries in the crash, she said, and officials weren’t sure how long it would take to reopen the road.

“We can’t have anyone driving underneath,” she said. “They have crews en route coming to take the entire structure down.”

Eastbound traffic was diverted to Route 29 and ramps from Route 29 and Route 28 to I-66 were shut down. Commuters should expect heavy traffic, officials said.
description: A vehicle struck an overhead sign.
